snippet.title: Finger Swagger Episode 4 - 30 Day Shifting Challenge with Dounis: Week 2
snippet.description:
This video was supposed to be released two weeks ago. It had been decided, however, to postpone the release because it felt wrong and inappropriate to post an episode of this playful series in the midst of so much pain and sorrow. Black Lives Matter. And ENCORE Chamber Music stands with black voices. We will continue to listen & learn to make meaningful changes to our programs and curriculums going forward. 

___
ENCORE Chamber Music's Artistic Director Jinjoo Cho is challenging herself for 30 days to master the biggest problem of any serious violinists, SHIFTS. And she is getting to know the famous 20th-century violin pedagogue, D.C Dounis along the way! The challenge is not only for violin students but also for teachers who wanted to know more about the Dounis methods. Leave us comments about your journey throughout the challenge! 

***Subscribe to the channel, and set your alarm to be notified for new uploads***

Featured Book:
D.C. Dounis - Range of Position Studies, Op.36

Link for download: http://petruccimusiclibrary.ca/files/imglnks/caimg/c/c3/IMSLP533117-PMLP862189-D._C._Dounis_op._36.pdf

Featured Exercises:
Chapter 1, No. 1
Chapter 2, No. 1-12

___
Website: http://www.encorechambermusic.org 
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/encorechambermusic 
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/encorechambermusic 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/encorechmbrmusc

___
ENCORE Chamber Music is an arts leadership and education organization, founded in 2015 by world-renowned violin soloist Jinjoo Cho on the principle that the future of classical music depends on a comprehensive, multi-disciplinary approach to its pedagogy. Over the past four years ENCORE has hosted intensive summer training programs for 227 talented young violinists, violists and cellists ages 13 to 26 at the Gilmour Academy in Gates Mills, Ohio.

ENCORE Chamber Music’s mission is to bring the world’s most exceptional musicians to Cleveland to inspire, educate, and innovate the art of engagement in music. Our goal is to build a premier international summer festival and year-round community residency programs. We seek to contribute to our Cleveland community by performing music of the highest caliber, by engaging our audiences in larger cultural conversations, and by educating the next generation of artist-citizens to become dedicated and conscientious leaders in the field of classical music.
